context.title: App Engine Deployment - Standard Environment
context.description: Properties used when deploying the project to the App Engine standard environment. Account Google user account with permissions to deploy the project. Project The Google Cloud Platform project that is the deployment target. If you want to create a new project, follow the link to open the Cloud Console. Version The version of the app that will be created or replaced by this deployment. If you do not specify a version, one will be generated for you. Promote the deployed version to receive all traffic All traffic will be directed to this version once the deployment finishes. Stop previous version Stop the previously running version when deploying a new version that receives all traffic. Staging bucket The Google Cloud Storage bucket used to stage files associated with the deployment. If this argument is not specified, the application's default code bucket is used.

context.title: App Engine Deployment - Flexible Environment
context.description: Properties used when deploying the project to the App Engine flexible environment. App Engine configuration folder The folder that contains the configuration files used for the deployment, such as app.yml. Docker file location The path to the Docker image to be used for a custom runtime.
